subject: Re: [junit] Fake HTTP request/response implementation
msgSnippet: The Spring Framework (www.springframework.org) also has a neat mock objects jar which has handy mock http request/response objects. jc On Sun, 27 Mar 2005
messageBody:
The Spring Framework (www.springframework.org) also has a neat mock
objects jar which has handy mock http request/response objects.

jc


On Sun, 27 Mar 2005 18:03:14 -0500, Jeff Nielsen
<jeff.nielsen@...> wrote:
>
> We have successfully used the
>
> servletunit.HttpServletRequestSimulator
> servletunit.HttpServletResponseSimulator
>
> that come with the "Struts Test Case" distribution. I like them becuase
> they are simple and straightforward to use. (You can use just these
> classes, whether or not you are testing a struts app.) They also have fake
> versions of FilterChain, FilterConfig, RequestDispatcher, HttpSession,
> ServletConfig, ServletContext, etc.
>
> See http://strutstestcase.sourceforge.net
>
> Jeff Nielsen
> www.digitalfocus.com
>
>
